bbc.title: Ex-police chief said Trump told him in 2006 'everyone' knew of Epstein's behaviour
bbc.description: The now-president allegedly called police in Florida who were investigating Epstein and said "thank goodness you're stopping him".

bbc.title: FBI releases images of masked person in hunt for Savannah Guthrie's mother
bbc.description: The mother of the news anchor Savannah disappeared in the middle of night from her Tucson, Arizona, home and was last seen on 31 January.

bbc.title: Laegreid wins bronze then confesses to affair on TV
bbc.description: Winter Olympics bronze medallist Sturla Holm Laegreid says on live TV that he made the "biggest mistake" by cheating on his girlfriend.

bbc.title: Pilot praised after crash-landing faulty Somali passenger plane on seashore
bbc.description: All 55 people on board survived after the plane failed to land on the runway near the shoreline.

bbc.title: Macron urges Europe to start acting like world power
bbc.description: The French president warns of growing threats from China, Russia and now the US, saying Europe faces a "wake-up call".

bbc.title: Bid launched to extend Zimbabwe president's term in office
bbc.description: President Mnangagwa's term in office is due to end in 2028 but a bill could open the way for him to extend that time.

bbc.title: French former teacher charged with abusing 89 teens dating back to 1960s
bbc.description: Jacques Leveugle allegedly kept a diary of the abuse which also spanned several countries, prompting police to appeal for more victims to come forward.

bbc.title: Trump threatens to block opening of US-Canada bridge
bbc.description: The White House has reiterated its demands even after a 'positive' call between Trump and Mark Carney.

wsj.title: Palestinians Stream Back to Northern Gaza on Foot
wsj.description: Israel allowed displaced Gazans to begin crossing a military zone that bisects the enclave after a deadlock over hostage releases was broken.

wsj.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Safe-Haven City
wsj.description: Residents of Goma reported gunfire and shelling after rebels overran Congolese troops. U.N. officials estimated that more than one million displaced people were now inside the city.

wsj.title: Cocaine-Funded Gangs Shake Colombia Years After Peace Pact
wsj.description: Attacks by powerful militias against civilians reflect the state’s inaction eight years after a peace accord removed a powerful rebel group from the field.

wsj.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
wsj.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia was down 16%.

wsj.description: The Yen and Swiss Franc were stronger against the dollar as investors sought safe havens after Chinese start-up DeepSeek’s new AI model hit U.S. tech stocks.
